thread.title: How the NLRB Evades the Law—and Can Bring Itself Into Line

author: Peter Schaumber
title: How the NLRB Evades the Law—and Can Bring Itself Into Line

organizations.name: u.s. court of appeals for the district of columbia circuit

text:
In the wrong hands the National Labor Relations Board can become a law unto itself. In the past, it has spent thousands of taxpayer dollars prosecuting employers in cases it knew would be reversed on appeal. In one 2016 ruling, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit criticized President Obama’s NLRB for using a 60-year-old policy as an “instrument of oppression” against unionized businesses. President Trump’s board appointees should change this policy, which the Obama administration abused, and replace it with a new rule that prevents the hounding of businesses with meritless prosecutions.
